alert.note: Alert for Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 14 at 11:17AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. Humboldt River At Comus affecting Humboldt County. .Warm daytime temperatures along with low temperatures remaining above freezing overnight will continue to encourage snow melt. River flows will remain elevated through at least this week. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Battle Mountain. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Minor lowland flooding throughout the reach. A few rural roads begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM PDT Wednesday was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 9.7 feet. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 03/30/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
